headline: Broccoli and Chicken Stir-Fry
description: This chicken and broccoli recipe makes for a quick weeknight dinner. Stir-fry chicken, broccoli, and onion in a mix of soy, ginger, and brown sugar.

video.description: Such an easy and delicious stir-fry full of vegetables and spicy flavors!
video.name: Broccoli and Chicken Stir-Fry

name: Broccoli and Chicken Stir-Fry
recipeIngredient: 1 pinch red pepper flakes, or to taste
2 teaspoons vegetable oil, or to taste
3 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cut into chunks

recipeInstructions.text: Stir soy sauce, brown sugar, ginger, and red pepper flakes together in a bowl until sugar dissolves. Mix water and cornstarch together in a small bowl; stir with a whisk until cornstarch dissolves completely.
Heat oil in a large skillet over high heat. Fry chicken and onion in hot oil until chicken is no longer pink in the center and onion is tender, 5 to 7 minutes.
Stir in broccoli with chicken and onion; sauté until broccoli is hot, about 5 minutes.
Push chicken and vegetable mixture to the side of the skillet. Pour soy sauce mixture into the vacant part of the skillet. Stir cornstarch slurry into soy sauce mixture until the color is consistent.
Move chicken and vegetables back into the center of the pan; sauté until sauce thickens and coats chicken and vegetables, about 5 minutes more.

review.reviewBody: made it just like the recipe, using low sodium soy sauce. It was very good, would have rated 4 1/2 stars if I could have. Next time I'll add some mushrooms and bell peppers.

Delicious w my modifications. I added a whole red pepper sliced instead of the hot flakes as I wanted no heat. I also added 3 minced cloves of garlic. Next time I will use less sugar. For the oil I used half vegetable and half toasted sesame w a splash of EVOO. My first thing cooked in my brand new seasoned steel wok.
This was an excellent and quick meal. I added fresh ginger and it turned out amazingly delicious.
Very yummy. I added some chicken broth to make it more saucy for serving over rice.
Way too salty, either use low sodium soy souce or dilute it with chicken broth

I made this to the recipe minus just a little bit of the brown sugar. I thought it turned out good and enjoyed it. Made the House Fried Rice to put it on. I would have given it five stars but the sauce which is mostly just soy was missing something. I still enjoyed it and will make it again. Perhaps I will add a teaspoon of oyster sauce to it.
I made this dish on yesterday but I included flank steak and added garlic cloves and it was delish. I did get the low sodium soy sauce. I saw all the comments about the saltiness of the soy sauce.

As written, the recipe is way too salty and made this almost inedible. My son took one bite and would not eat anymore. I'm from the generation of "you will eat what's on your plate" so I toughed it out but even then, I only ate half of what was on my plate. I feel the recipe has potential and I will try a low sodium approach but if that does not work, I will not be making this again.
It was really good but it was WAY to salty for us I definitely will have it again but I Recommend less soy sauce or low sodium
I just love this dish and it is very healthy for me too
Good and I’d make it again except, as others have noted, I’d definitely use low sodium soy sauce. The sauce bites because of it and I’m a salt lover.

This is one of our favorite recipes! Sometimes I use sambal instead of red pepper flakes (or in addition to). I typically only have low sodium soy sauce on hand, less salty. I add cauliflower and carrots and serve it with rice. Yum!

Very simple and fast. Too salty for me, I do not add salt to my food either in cooking or a plate. Otherwise, very tasty. I did not have Broccoli. I did add no flour noodles. Definitely make again with less salt. I even used low sodium soy sauce. Thank you

It was tasty, and I followed the sauce exactly.Next time I will cut back on the auger and use low sodium soy sauce. I did add some yellow peppers and zucchini for more veggies. My husband liked it a lot and suggested I make it with shrimp as a change.
I added rice cooked in chicken stock and water chestnuts. Got 2 thumbs up from my 4yr old grand baby.
Crazy salty.
I always make double sauce. I also use a little less sugar and I add garlic. Pretty good recipe.
Quick, easy, and delish
Great flavor in this recipe. I added carrots and sugar snap peas. The broccoli took longer to cook than the five minutes listed.
My husband and son said “it’s a keeper”. I followed the recipe. I added a cup of carrots to the chicken and onions. Trying to eat more veggies. It was delish, and easy.
The recipe looked easy, and it was. Was pleasantly surprised by how flavorful the dish turned out. Will put this one in the monthly rotation. Cheers!!!

Instead of soy sauce I opt to use Liquid Aminos in this recipe which I consider to be a ls soy sauce substitute, you can find it in the Asian section of grocery stores. It taste like soy sauce with much less sodium then Lower sodium versions of soy sauce. this recipe was fabulous and I am adding it to my menu rotation!
Added carrots and cashews. Used shredded cauliflower instead of rice.
I made this but I had to improvise and use cinnamon for the ginger. Surprisingly tasty. Next time will use ginger. My kids loved it.
Only change yet not needed was I added mushrooms. Was super delicious my husband loved it and asked me if I got it from a restaurant… making this for my parents.

Being generous with 2 stars since my kid who we have to normally take the salt shaker away from thought it was okay. As written, this recipe is a disaster. It's way too salty. I read the reviews and used 1/2 c. Low sodium soy sauce. It was still too salty and all you taste is the soy sauce. The sauce is too thick. It doesn't need 2T of cornstarch-1 is plenty. If I make again, I will try 1/3 c low sodium soy sauce and 1/3 c. chicken broth. I'll also add a lot more broccoli and some carrots. I'll do the chicken differently so it doesn't dry out.

Deliciousness! Even my teenage grandson loved it. I added yellow and zucchini squash, red bell pepper and a bit more black pepper. To me the sauce was a bit bland until I added more pepper. But overall was a very good base for me to add my own touches. Definitely will make it again.

Liked this recipe. I am more of a veggie girl than meat. Used less chicken, less soy sauce, no brown sugar, no cornstarch & water. Plus added more seasoning, mushrooms, yellow, red & green bell peppers. It was good.
This recipe was easy to prepare and the ingredients were already in hand. Everyone liked it and my only change was to add more vegetables, carrots,celery and grern pepper. We will make it again.

This was really good as written, even if a bit cloying for someone with a crippling sweet tooth. That could have been also due to having to use coconut aminos when the Tamari ran out. We'll cut the sugar in half next time either way. We prefer thighs to breasts, so a lb was cut up in place. There was about a cup of zucchini already cut up, so a cup of broccoli was replaced by that. I'd still increase the broccoli by another cup, possibly using other veggies. We replaced cornstarch with arrowroot at the same amounts, and it thickened mega quickly. Served over brown rice, the two of us inhaled this with no leftovers for lunch.
Such an easy delicious recipe for anyone to make
This was easy and yummy. My only suggestion is to increase the soy sauce mixture with a little water. I wanted more sauce and this did the trick.

I made this before and I agree, it was a little too salty. So, I am going to make it tonight and I am going to use only 1/3 cup Soy sauce, add carrots, maybe mushrooms use all the spices, onion and last but not least, add a little sesame oil. I can't wait. I love stir-fry dishes. Yummy!!! ??

I used 2 bags of frozen broccoli and the frozen grilled chicken strips ( from Aldi). Then I didn't have to wait for the chicken or broccoli...I just cooked them I the microwave and sautéed for about 2-3 minutes with onion before mixing in the sauces. Turned out delicious!!!
My quick and easy workweek dinner. One of the family favs

This is a great recipe, with some amendments. I used steam in bag broccoli and after getting the sauce to a boil threw the chicken and broccoli in with it. Like other reviewers, I cut the soy sauce in half and used chicken broth instead. It was still too salty and we like salt! We also added about a TBSP of lemon juice to cut the sweetness of the brown sugar. I think next time we will use 1/4 the soy sauce and the rest chicken broth. It is a GREAT basic recipe and you could use about any veggies you want, and swap out the protein source as well. Thanks for sharing. This will be our go to recipe for stir fry from now on. It’s also quick to throw together.
I've made this may times using a mixture of approx 5 cups of vegies: broccoli, carrots, snow peas, pineapple, mushroom, baby corn, etc. There are never left-overs!
made this tonight..very good but the sauce was a bit overpowering. I also added yellow pepper and water chestnuts..Husband liked it but next time I will rethink the soy mixture.
It was fantastic I added a little twist to it. I added mushrooms, bamboo shoots and water chestnuts. Turned out great.
Very good! I have made this several times. I find it's a little dry, so I make double the sauce.
This is the best stir fry recipe I have used!
I changed things up a bit but I mainly used the recipe as a guideline then built on it.
Just made this tonight. It's really good! One small thing is it is extremely salty. I would recommend using low sodium soy sauce.

It was tasty but a little too sweet for my taste. Next time I will add less brown sugar, more red pepper flakes but I didn’t want it to taste too spicy because I don’t like that. I did add minced garlic when I cooked the onion. Next time also I will make more sauce. There just wasn’t enough if you followed the recipe.
Way too salty and I used 1/3 less soy. I wish I would have read the reviews first but wanted to find a quick recipe to use the chicken I had laid out and my leftover rice. Not a keeper
Excellent!!!!

This was an easy to throw together meal and we both loved it! Ingredients are pantry staples for me. I used chicken tenderloins I had in the freezer and they were perfect for this. I was asked to keep this recipe on hand so yeah, I consider it a win!

This is an excellent all around stir fry recipe. Lighten up on the soy sauce by half and use unsalted chicken broth to make up the difference. Then add back salt or soy sauce as preferred. My favorite is Broccoli Beef so I've used top sirloin instead of the chicken. Excellent using just veggies or shrimp as well.

It was great, and everyone really liked it. I read the bad reviews, so I cut the soy by a 1/3 and replaced it with orange juice. Other than that, I followed the recipe (I doubled it). It was a great Easter dinner!!! The other yummy on the plate are lettuce wraps...also yummy.
Really salty, especially if you're on a cardiac diet. Otherwise good.
Bitter. I would not cook the broccoli with the chicken and onions. I would cook it separately and then add. Too strong of a soy sauce flavor as well. Will not make this again.
Easy and delicious way better than bagged stir fry fresh kit or frozen. This was so good.
We made and enjoyed this recipe several times, and will still make it again and again.
Just right. I made this exactly as written. It was just what I was looking for in a simple, quick meal. Definitely a keeper.
This was terribly salty. I like salt but could hardly eat this. It may be really good with low sodium soy sauce, but I tried it as written.
Easy and good but was a little salty. I would probably do half the soy sauce next time.
Turned out amazing!!!! Followed the recipe exactly with the exception of halving the water/corn starch mixture (just like all the other reviews mentioned). Boyfriend was so impressed!!
Taste great and Very easy to follow
Sauce was tasty but did not thicken as I had hoped.
wow what a waste of time! Total salt bomb, we couldn't eat it. Won't be making this again!
Easy and tasty
This was a easy recipe to make. It’s really good and I will definitely make it again.

5 stars based off the fact there wasn’t a morsel left. My husband devoured this. I cooked the chicken first then set aside while I sautéed the veggies as I was worried the chicken would get over cooked. I also added garlic, carrots and mushrooms. I’d make it again but halve the ginger and increase the brown sugar and chilli flakes. Best part was that it was easy to take some cooked chicken and quickly boil some of the chopped veggies to make deconstructed dishes for my littles (18 months and 3.5). 5 stars when the whole family eats all of their dinner!
Too salty
Really enjoyed this the first time we made this. Making again for the second time. Easy and tasty.
I used wingettes i baked them first, I then sauteed them with the onions and I also added sliced carrots and cauliflower
We really enjoyed this meal. My wife commented the only thing missing was the little paper "take-out" container!
Way too salty.
I added garlic and red bell pepper. Also lightly coated the chicken with corn starch before cooking in the wok.

I used low-sodium soy sauce, so saltiness wasn't a problem. But the sauce just tasted like soy sauce; and with the amount of it in the recipe, it was a rather overwhelming flavor. I appreciate the chicken-and-broccoli inspiration, but will look for a recipe with a more complex flavor. Thanks for sharing, though!
My fiance and I loved it. I think I'll use low sodium soy sauce next time.
I cooked the chicken just a little longer because I like mine well cooked and used the low sodium soy. It was perfect!

Loved this recipe. Cut back on the soy sauce per other reviews. Wished I wouldn't have. Substituted fresh ginger for powdered ginger...half the veggie oil for sesame oil...added carrot sticks,sliced celery, jalapeno slices,and topped with green onion and cilantro. Awesome dish... definitely will make again!
One of our faves!
So good!

I made this with a few more vegetables than just the broccoli. It was amazingly fast! and really really surprisingly good for how easy it was.. 
I added carrot, green pepper, zucchini and the broccoli as I had them in the house. Wonderful easy recipe!
I added garlic

This is an awesome basic stir fry recipe but I substituted frozen mixed stir fry vegetables for the broccoli only and added water chestnuts. Have made with chicken , boiled shrimp and vegetarian style over rice. Delicious!!!!
Very easy recipe but too much soy sauce. Very salty. I suggest cutting that down to 1/2 cup. Also, I added sesame oil to add some more depth to the flavors.

Great recipe! Made it exactly as described and it was delicious. Too salty with regular soy sauce. Next time I will try low sodium soy sauce or do half soy sauce/half teriyaki to cut the salty flavor.
Way too salty!!!!! I would definitely cut back the soy sauce to not only 1/3 cup, but also use low sodium.

I followed the recipe after adjusting it for two, and it was not nice. We found it thick and cloying and on the sweet side. The one thing I didn't think it was...was salty. I've unsaved it. We definitely won't be making it again.

I must agree with Della M. It's very easy and simple but way to salty. I even used half of soy sauce that recipe called for. Still way too salty. My husband had a headache and my son had a tummy ache. 2/3 cups of soy sauce is way too much. Very disappointing experience.
so easy it was a hit
Wow! Handy and tasty meal that is quick and easy to make! Quick and easy...two of my favorite ingredients!
No substitutions. Super yummmm!!
Second time making this dish. Easy to make and quick for a week night dinner.
Made this recipe for dinner and it was very well received! Recipe was simple and easy to follow. I added mushrooms too which added an extra flavor. Will definitely make this recipe again!
Great recipe. Easy to make. Anyone sensitive to sodium, I recommend using low sodium soy sauce.

Was very short on time so I followed this recipe exactly (I only use low sodium soy sauce so full strength might have been salty) and it was excellent as written. Served over egg noodles. Dinner was ready in under 30 minutes and was flavourful and filling. Definitely earned the 5 stars. Next time when I don’t feel so rushed, I’ll do as other reviewers have done and try adding various ingredients to the base. Thanks!

Very tasty but grossly unhealthy with over 3,300 mg. of sodium per serving. Daily allowance is no more than 2,300 mg. a day. 1,500 mg. is preferred. Either cut the soy sauce drastically or find a no salt soy sauce.
TOO SALTY, even with low salt spy sauce, Not happy, ruined the flavor

This was super tasty and pretty easy to do. I added some more veggies along with the broccoli, and there was plenty of sauce to cover. I may add some nuts next time too. Adding this into the regular rotation!

I made this recipe and it was delicious. I used fresh ginger and added fresh garlic. I also thinned out the soy sauce with water so that it wouldn’t be too salty. All in all it was great. I will make it again.
This was delicious! My only recommendation is to add a lot more broccoli than what it calls for.
This was amazing!

I did have extra chicken & added sliced carrots, more broccoli & doubled the sauce. Normally I use low Sodium Soy sauce, as it was pretty salty. The flavor was very good a very tasty & an easy dish that I'll make again. Family loved it. Prep did take me a little longer than statedbut cook time was spot on

I love all stir-fry! I marinaded the chicken in the soy sauce mixture for about 45 minutes, then boiled the sauce and set it aside. It was either doing that, or possibly using less chicken than the recipe called for, or both, but the dish was too salty. I won't marinade it the next time. I also used a Pizza Hut take-out packet of red pepper in the dish and half a packet would have been better for my taste.
Awesome. Just double the sauce mix and thickener and it’s amazing!
